frameDefinitions: An Agent leaves behind a Theme effectively rendering it no longer within their control or of the normal security as one's property.
A Wearer removes an item of Clothing from a Body_location (the part of the body that the Clothing is prototypically worn on.)
An Author creates a Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech,  that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular Addressee in mind.
A particular Binding_principle is (or is not) operative, that is, any obligations, restrictions, and any other aspects of the Binding_principle are (or are not) in effect.
A Wearer puts on an item of Clothing, which then occupies the Body_location.
An Agent creates a Knot (possibly in a Place and/or with an Instrument).'
frameExamples: Carolyn <t>abandoned</t> her car and jumped on a red double decker bus.
Walking on sand is better if you <t>take</t> <t>off</t> your shoes. INI
I <t>penned</t> a letter concerning racism to Congress.
This law will only become in <t>effect</t> during the last three weeks of the year.
You didn't have to <t>dress</t> like a pirate to impress me. INI
Loretta <t>ties</t> the most beautiful bowline I've ever seen.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fex name='Agent'>Agent</fex> is the person who acts to leave behind the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fex name='Theme'>Theme</fex> is the entity that is relinguished to no one from the <fex name='Agent'>Agent</fex>'s possession.
When the <fen>Agent</fen> gives up the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> gives up the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The individual who begins the action wearing the <fen>Clothing</fen> and ends the action without it.
The item that the <fen>Wearer</fen> is initially wearing but then removes.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Wearer</fen> undresses.
The location at which the <fen>Wearer</fen> undresses an item of <fen>Clothing</fen>.
The <fen>Author</fen> produces a particular <fen>Text</fen>.
The entity which results from the act of writing or speaking.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the text is created.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is the law, contract, principle, or other (set of) obligations that is (or is not) operational.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is in effect.
The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is or is not operational.
The individual that puts <fen>Clothing</fen> on their body.
<fen>Clothing</fen> is used for the item of clothing that the <fen>Wearer</fen> ends up wearing.
The time when the <fen>Wearer</fen> puts an item of <fen>Clothing</fen> on.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Donning occurs.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
The stable configuration of a String which results from tying.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The suspects</fex> had to strip publically and endure several blasts from a firehose.
Once <fex>the treaty</fex> is in effect, US port authorities and the Coast Guard will monitor compliance by checking any yacht 79 feet or longer.
All patent applicants and owners should be aware of the current uncertainty as to what patent fees will be in effect <fex>on October 1, 1998</fex>
This promotion is void <fex>in the state of Florida</fex>.
She had put the dress on <fex>this morning</fex> expecting it to be sunny.
